intro: Gyroptera somalensis, commonly known as the Somali gyroptera, is a unique flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
